definition: to give material assistance to
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: Rural folk are increasingly bringing food to relatives in the cities.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的农村居民给城市里的亲戚带去接济食物。

sentences.english: Like to do good things, and be happy?
sentences.chinese: 喜欢做善事，乐于拿财物接济有困难的人。

sentences.english: The little girl had come upon the parish ever since her parents died.
sentences.chinese: 小姑娘父母双亡后，就一直靠教区的接济生活。

sentences.english: Itas very nice of you to help me.
sentences.chinese: 你来接济我，你真是太好了。

sentences.english: Jesus wanted to heal the sick, feed the poor and teach.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣想要治愈疾病，接济教化穷人。

sentences.english: John is willing to tide over his sister a little longer.
sentences.chinese: 约翰愿意再接济她妹妹一些时候。

sentences.english: He received them, Lin Dong enough to live comfortably after six months of life.
sentences.chinese: 因为得到她们的接济，董林过了半年衣食无忧的生活。

sentences.english: Invite and help some people to recall what is it in their earliest memory.
sentences.chinese: 聘请若干人接济他们记忆他们最早的记忆是什么。

sentences.english: Now Judas sent necessaries to them that were within.
sentences.chinese: 犹大输送一切必需品，接济被围困的人。

definition: emergency relief/to help the needy with cash or goods
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
to live one's life/to make a living
hard pressed for money/in financial straits
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
impoverished/destitute
to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
to help/to assist financially
destitute/wretched poverty
extreme poverty (idiom); destitute/penniless/poor as church mice
poverty-stricken/poor
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
no way to get by
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
to economize on clothes and food/to scrimp and save (idiom)
